name: Pluggin Baby Presents: Rhino and the Ranters/The Strangler Figs/Red Crow/Sir O/Duggan. Jan 18th 2014
description:
A storming line up!

Rhino and the Ranters
The Strangler Figs (Feat Joe Pickering ex Duchamp Pilot)
Red Crow
Sir O
Duggan

O2 Academy 3, Birmingham

Over 8's show. 7pm start.

See you there!

name: A Guide to Getting Radio Airplay: The book by Emma Scott
description:
Its actually not that hard to get played on the radio - if you know how - so who best to ask than someone who has worked in radio as a presenter for over 24 years! 

Now only available from Amazon:

http://www.amazon.co.uk/Break-Your-Band-Getting-Airplay/dp/1446799816/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1386326046&sr=1-1&keywords=break+your+band


Readers of the book:  

"Emma, your book has shown me why we'd not been getting radio airplay in the past, and what we need to do to change that!  It’s full of really sound advice that in retrospect seem obvious, but aren’t, if you know what I mean. It's concise and hits the spot." 
 
"Blimey, Emma!! Your book is absolutely fantastic!! I learnt so much, so thank you very much!!”

So, there you have it, this book will change any musician or bands life! 

Increase your iTunes sales, bands awareness and get your music HEARD by thousands of people.

A lot of bands don't realise how important radio airplay is, and how many doors it can open - but, believe me, I know! It's amazing publicity for any band and as soon as one radio station plays you - more will follow.

It's full of gems, trade secrets and MORE!!

Your band WILL get radio airplay after reading this book.  Guaranteed!*

*if you're good!

Some more quotes from people who've read the book:
 
“I read your book last night, extremely well written and ticks all boxes!!! Essential to any band out there!”
 
"We found the Break Your Band book very helpful indeed!  It's often a bit baffling as to what etiquette exists - how to approach people, what to send, what information is required and what is unimportant, and perhaps most importantly what your expectations should be."

Paperback, 86 pages.

Written & devised by hugely experienced radio presenter, concert promoter & music industry expert Emma Scott. This book is the must read bible for any musician, artist manager or anyone interested in the music or radio business'. 

Seriously, what are you waiting for?

More info: http://breakyourband.co.uk

You can also download and buy this book from Amazon and lulu.com. Book a demo feedback session too! You won't regret either purchase.

name: Break Your Band - Demo Feedback Session
description:
This is one of our most popular Break Your Band sessions, and it's no wonder! 99% of the songs we feedback on fall victim to the same mistakes too. 

Emma Scott has 25 years radio experience and has produced and presented thousands of radio shows in this time. She's been part of many playlist meetings and knows what radio programmers are looking for.

This session can be very helpful if you have a rough demo recorded (even acoustic) or if you've already been in the recording studio.  It's ideal for artistes starting out as well as established musicians.

If you book me for a session, I'll listen to your song and let you know whether it's a good one to send to radio presenters and radio stations. A well-written song could attract you prime gigs, publishing and management, so it's important to get those songs right.

Is it radio friendly?  Is the quality good enough for airplay?  Will you grab the attention of a radio presenter, or will you make the same sort of mistakes we hear everyday whilst putting our radio show together?

I go through the song second by second - and give you all the positive feedback as well as ways to improve the sound of the song - and the arrangement.

I can give feedback on 1, 2 or 3 tracks.  If you want more, just email and ask about a price.

Look forward to hearing from you!

Questions? emmascottpresents@btinternet.com

name: Break Your Band - radio plugging
description:
Pluggin' Baby is here to get your music played on the radio!

More details on http://plugginbaby.com

We send your music to national, regional, local, community, university and podcast DJ's for you. We get you feedback and plays, which is amazing exposure for bands at any level.

We write your accompanying press release and set up streaming and downloading links on your behalf.  We will organise radio interviews and sessions for you when requested.

We have been obtaining plays on Radio Two, Kerrang! Radio, Amazing Radio, BBC Ulster, BBC London, BBC Introducing, Metro Radio, Clyde One, Radio 2XS, as well as XFM London and many, many other local shows, podcasts, student stations and specialist shows all over the country.

We have a great rapport with many DJ's and get great results for the bands and artists we plug. 

We will also send to music fanzines and websites to get you written coverage as well as radio airplay.

We know how expensive radio plugging can be, so want to offer a more manageable price for bands who want to take the next step up the ladder, without taking out a bank loan to cover the plugging fees.

Our fee is for one track. Email us for more information and to send us a track to here.  The whole process lasts around 4 weeks and you will be kept up to date of any feedback and plays that we get throughout that period. 

You can promote the radio airplay you have been getting - which will boost the band's profile no end!

Please email us for more info before booking:

emmapluggingbaby@gmail.com

If you want us to target fewer stations, we can look at reducing the rate for you. We'll tailor it to your music and budget.
